website_summaries.verdict: A great choice if you’re looking for a full-featured toothbrush at a great price, but you will have to put the time in to keeping it clean.
pros: Users report that their dentists recommended this model and have noticed the cleanliness of their teeth after its prolonged use
Multiple speeds help to ease manual brush users into it
cons: Mold growth seems to be a common problem with this model, particularly where the brush fits into the base

customer_reviews.title: No 30 Second Timer on This Model
customer_reviews.text: I'm unhappy with this product because I had no idea there would be no 30 second timer. I had a Sonicare for a long, long time, and it finally wore out, so I bought the Braun electric toothbrush. YUCK! Not a good product. I purchased this Sonicare Elite to get back up to par and am disappointed they didn't make it clear there would be no 30 second timer. It says there is a 2 minute timer and I think a consumer would assume there would be the quad timer built in.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Gee

customer_reviews.title: Beware!
customer_reviews.text: My brush head needs replacing. I have been trying to remove everyone the brush that my other Sonicare tb used. It refused to budge. I just hung up from Customer Service. Because this is an E series toothbrush, it requires the whole brush head that screws off. These are more expensive than just the brush that slides off.
customer_reviews.author: candy.

customer_reviews.title: The Mold Problems are True, and They'll Happen to You!
customer_reviews.text: The leaky design allows for mold to grow in the chamber above the battery, the threads, and up into the head. Nasty! It happened within weeks, so there's no way the designers missed that little problem. I leave the head off when it's not in use, and mold still finds a way to grow in there! The brush does a good job with cleaning, but wow, huge design flaw. Spend a little more on one that doesn't get black mold growing in it within weeks. Bleh! Oh yeah, and the replacement heads are highway robbery. Buy generic, there's no difference outside of the price..
customer_reviews.author: Buying_Stuff

customer_reviews.title: Great product. I'm so glad I got it!
customer_reviews.text: I really love this mop. It does a great job on my stone tile floor. I have a lot of tile to mop and halfway through I switch the pads for clean ones. One charge is more than enough to clean the whole floor. Though I do leave it charging when not in use so it's always ready to go. I also love that I can use my own cleaner. The best part is that once it's on, it feels like it hovers over the floor very lightly so I can use it even while I'm using a knee scooter due to surgery on my foot!
customer_reviews.author: Ana Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Great toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: Battery lasts a long time. Love my sonicaire toothbrush. Would not go back to regular brushing after I have used this. This is my second sonicaire I have purchased. They last a very long time. My only gripe is that the replacement heads can be spendy.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Jones

customer_reviews.title: Yay! Clean teeth!
customer_reviews.text: So my teeth are clean. I love how it disintegrates tooth paste to make you feel like it's really working. I do love feeling like my teeth just got polished from the dentist. This is our second set of sonicare tooth brushes, and we've been a fan of them for years. We also love that it comes with a traveling case now! So much easier for...uh... Traveling! I wish the replacement heads were a little cheaper but the toothbrush is so much cheaper now! The toothbrush is $60 cheaper now than when we bought our original several years ago. Gotta love that! If you're thinking about an electric toothbrush, do it, it's only $40 and you won't be dissapointed.
customer_reviews.author: Gracie mom of boys

customer_reviews.title: Great product but vibrations were uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use for myself and it's a great toothbrush but after a week of using, I just didn't like how strong the vibrations were, though my teeth felt extremely polished, it just tickled my gums which made it uncomfortable to use. It's a great product so far and it would have been 5 stars if it had a vibration setting to control. If you don't mind the vibrations and you like teeth feeling polished, I see no reason you should not get this great deal and awesome toothbrush.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Best Electric Toothbrush On The Market
customer_reviews.text: I love using this toothbrush. I can breeze thru my morning/nighttime bathroom routine and my teeth feel great and healthy. Previously, I used the more expensive Philips Sonicare model for 5 years and when it broke I did not have over $165 to buy another one so I went with this, the Philips Sonicare Essence Rechargeable Electric Toothbrush. I was shocked at how well it worked. It came with 2 new heads, charges right up and is full of speed. For $49 you get the SAME cleaning power as the expensive Sonicare. I highly reccomend. Couldn't ask for more.
customer_reviews.author: MReader

customer_reviews.title: A whiner
customer_reviews.text: I have had this toothbrush for 2 years and at various times, it has produced a high-pitched very loud whine as I brush, and lately it occurred to me that this could possibly damage my hearing. I've tried thoroughly cleaning all the threads, screwing down as tightly as possible. Nothing helps. I replaced the brush head a few weeks ago, but still have the problem. Ear plugs just seem to make the experience more intense and compacted. I'm going to go back to using a manual toothbrush while I consider other options. Maybe a battery operated toothbrush. I have one with a round head for travel and it seems to work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Montaff

customer_reviews.title: QUALITY AGAIN NOT THERE
customer_reviews.text: I have just about ran out of patience with Philips & "quality" after owning 5 of this brand in the past. This time with the new "Sonicare" on which the charging light stays on 24/7 after 2 weeks of ownership. It is supposed to be on ONLY WHEN THE BATTERY IS BEING CHARGED. (So says Phillips) Have checked the new charger that came with the unit. It appears fine. Tried the charger from the old unit. It also appears fine. Ever tried to get a reply from Philips customer service on the Net? I no longer would recommend this brand even though I will continue to use until it (or I) die. Not expected from Phillips. John
customer_reviews.author: John G. Griffiths

customer_reviews.title: Phillips Sonicare Toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: My dentist recommended I get this rechargeable electric toothbrush to deal with plaque, possibly due to dry mouth. Certain meds that I take really make my mouth dry & it seems that the Sonicare is helping reduce the plaque. It's a nice feeling to feel smoothness where I used to feel a plaque buildup long before I was due for an office cleaning. I'd say the hardest thing for me to get used to, is that "crazy tingling" early in the morning! I'm not a morning person & it kind of takes me by surprise ~ every time! It does the job though, & I & my dentist are both pleased with the results!
customer_reviews.author: Lady Nite Owl

customer_reviews.title: does the job and does it well
customer_reviews.text: This is our second Sonicare toothbrush. The previous one lasted several years but finally wouldn't accept a charge. This is a low end handle, but I don't see a reason to spend extra money on bells and whistles. Functionally from the perspective of actually brushing your teeth, this is the same as more expensive models. I don't feel the need for a beep to tell me to move on to the next quadrant of my mouth or whatever. There are nicer looking models (Diamond Clean) and models with several features that I don't need, like settings for sensitive teeth and the like, which I also don't need. This one does the job for me.
customer_reviews.author: Sruli

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice electric toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice electric toothbrush, but they're some hang ups. I like how the unit works, but on this particular model it is very prone to becoming dirty. Toothpaste will get stuck inside the removal upper half, but this issue does not exist in the higher end models. The only other issue i have with this unit is the cost of the replacement heads. Oral B replacement heads are cheaper, so over the course of a year or two the Oral B electric toothbrush will become a better cost investment. Also i find the oral B circular head to do a slightly better job of giving your mouth the clean feeling similar to a dental cleaning visit.
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: Happy first-time user
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Sonicare brush - I bought it at the insistance of my DDS. He said "it needs to be a Sonicare". Low and behold: after my first use I noticed my teeth were so much smoother and they felt cleaner. I was pretty much amazed by the feel of it. The nice feature is that it has a 2 minute timer; it stops once the 2 minutes are up. Another great aspect is that the battery charge lasts a really long time. Per the advise of my DDS, I still need to keep up with daily flossing and daily use of the Sonicare to help prevent cavaties. 10-4, doc!
customer_reviews.author: Jen87

customer_reviews.title: Gets teeth super clean
customer_reviews.text: This toothbrush is way better that my old electric toothbrush. After brushing, my teeth feel as if I just returned from the dentist. I did wince at the cost of replacement heads though. I guess I will worry about that when the bristles are worn out. The manual has instructions on how to remove the batteries for disposal when they wear out. Once the batteries are shot, you have to throw the toothbrush away. On line registration gets the warranty extended to 2.5 years, so I figure it will last at least three years. Even if it fails right out of warranty, having super clean teeth would bring me back for another Sonicare toothbrush.
customer_reviews.author: spots

customer_reviews.title: Long Lasting Brand!
customer_reviews.text: Got two units with four head for the whole family. they are wonderful even though I forgot to review them years ago when we bought them. Years later, still going strong, just had to replace heads as they got worn and bases still going strong! Wonderful brand, hearty and stands up to teenager user and abuse well.
customer_reviews.author: Tee's

customer_reviews.title: Great toothbrush for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice toothbrush. I have been using it for over 5 years and I am amazed that the battery is still going strong even after using it daily for more than 5 years. It turns off after 2 minutes to take out any guesswork out. I love the clean feeling my teeth have after using it every day. I have also traveled with it internationally and it worked like a charm. You cannot go wrong with this for this price. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: RJain

customer_reviews.title: Good for long travels.
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Great for traveling. I travel often so I bring this along. Have gone 10 days using twice daily without charging so far. The automatic shut off after 2 minutes is great so I know when I'm done. At first this will train your gums and teeth at a slower speed then increase gradually. But be warned, even in the beginning, it brushes quite hard. Only downfall I can think of is that you must clean between the handle and brush head frequently, if not it gets a bit grimy and filmy inside after a few brushes. But it is easily cleaned. Very good design.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: NO LOW BATTERY INDICATOR
customer_reviews.text: I like it PROs - works good and hold battery for pretty long time! The brush has lasted me than 2 months, and it's still working CONs- there is no sign of LOW battery. I don't have charger in my bathroom so I left it's fully charged in my kitchen. Once it's full, I leave the toothbrush inside the bathroom and use it until it's run out of battery. I hated it when the toothbrush completely dead when I am in a middle of brushing! The Brush is also very expensive, it's same price as a whole set when they're onsale.
customer_reviews.author: Top 100 Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: I liked it
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product! Lasted me years on end and was compact and efficient and easy to travel with. The only dislike is that the battery slowly died and eventually just ended up breaking.
customer_reviews.author: Ariel Avshalumov

customer_reviews.title: Good value; works well
customer_reviews.text: First electric toothbrush, so for me it took some getting used to. That said, it seems to do a good job. I haven't given the battery life a tough test yet - it's been living on the stand so far. Initial charging took several hours, but since then it seems to recharge quite quickly and has plenty of power. Brush head has so far stood up well. Battery/motor unit is sealed so is easy to rinse clean. Overall, seems good value for money - it is hard to see what more an expensive model could provide.
customer_reviews.author: Philip C.

customer_reviews.title: Good basic electric toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: This is a good electric toothbrush. It is powerful and does the job. My biggest pet peeve about this toothbrush is that water gets into compartment where you remove the head of the brush and the base. It is watertight so I don't believe it will ruin it, however it gets gross after a while. It is not something you I often look at because I only see it every few months when I change the head. However because of this I would recommend a different sonicare brush. This could just be because I brush my teeth in a 'messy' way but I will be looking to get a different philips toothbrush soon.
customer_reviews.author: tesserlei

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Makes a huge difference.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! I've been using these for years. Even though my teeth were always pretty clean, the dentist immediately noticed a difference when I switched from standard toothbrush to this. It is good on the gums and prevents receding gum lines long as you don't press hard on it and let the bristles do all the work. My whole family uses them now. Even bought one for my mom and she loves it! I have not upgraded to the more advanced model. Seems more gimmicky then it is worth. This one works perfect.
customer_reviews.author: The G. Hansen

customer_reviews.title: This is my second Sonicare electric toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: My old Sonicare toothbrush finally died after about 12 years of use. I bought this one to replace it and have been happy with it. With the new e-series brush heads I did have problems with water collecting inside. A few times I opened it and it was black and mildewy inside! Eeeeuww! But after reading other reviews, everyone said to take it apart once a week to clean it out and let it dry. I've been doing that and it's been fine. If you do that, you shouldn't have any problems with mildew forming inside. I hope I get another 12 years out of this model!
customer_reviews.author: Tammy L.

customer_reviews.title: Love that Sonicare
customer_reviews.text: I read other reviews before picking this product and was warned about the unit not staying charged so discussed this problem with my husband, an electronic technician and he informed me the toothbrush was not meant to stay on the unit all the time, just when it needed charging and that would make it stop working sooner so...as long as I just charge it every couple of days, until the light stops flashing...so far, so good!! Plus, the replaceable heads were not more expensive than the whole unit, like at the stores!
customer_reviews.author: nancybh

customer_reviews.title: Magic level is too dam high
customer_reviews.text: I tried one of these as I was waiting for my order to come through at my aunt's house and it was weird. The vibrating just feels like it's going to knock all your teeth out and you gums feel overstimulated. I thought since my dentist recommended it, it was cool but I was wrong. My teeth were like, "na bro, this is not cool." Having to hold it at a 45 degree angle every time is odd too, it just felt a huge distraction the whole time. I'll to a manual toothbrush. I'm too noob for this kind of power
customer_reviews.author: Mikel Adurino

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money, best teeth cleaning I've ever experienced.
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought this for my boyfriend after receiving my own in pink. We have both been extremely happy. We have had them a little over 6 months and I can tell a radical difference from using a regular toothbrush, or even cheaper electric toothbrushes. The Sonicare times your brushing to let you know when you're done, and it leaves your teeth feeling cleaner than any other toothbrush I've experienced. Not only that but they seem to stay clean all day long. I would highly recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: TJ Farmer

customer_reviews.title: It was disgusting and unless you like to brush with mold or ...
customer_reviews.text: After about a month of use I took this product apart and discovered mold/mildew growing inside the cavity between the battery part and the brush. It was disgusting and unless you like to brush with mold or tear the toothbrust every week I don't recommend using this.
customer_reviews.author: A. M. Miller

customer_reviews.title: My second Sonicare
customer_reviews.text: My first Sonicare lasted about 8 years, with brush head changes regularly. This model is almost identical to my original. In fact, I think the brush heads are the same size. This is a very basic Sonicare model, but it definitely does a great job. For the money, you can not do better than this toothbrush. The Sonicare vibrations in your mouth take some getting used to, but once familiar, you will never go back to manual brushing. Highly recommended. I also opted for the Amazon packaging, which meant a custom made Amazon cardboard box, without the horrible, difficult to open plastic packaging. Excellent idea from Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Nitty's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Like most others
customer_reviews.text: Like most others, I’m quite happy with this product! I purchased the product after it was recommended by my dentist. The power of the Sonicare toothbrush is amazing. It cleans my teeth much better than other toothbrushes I’ve owned. The unit is rechargeable. Over time, I’m sure that the battery life will degrade; currently it lasts 2-3 weeks before it needs recharged. The detachable toothbrush head comes with a tightly fitting plastic cover for travel. However, I’ve found that steripods work better. The provided cover fits too tightly, so my toothbrush stays wet (gross!). Overall, I highly recommend this product (so does my dentist!).
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Varghese

customer_reviews.title: Very good brush, bad design, gets dirty inside
customer_reviews.text: I guess it is good for what you pay, if I strictly talk about the brush functions, it works really well and I like the fact that it turns off automatically after two minutes of brushing, telling you the optimal time for a good clean. However I'm just rating this 3 stars due to the fact that it collects saliva and water inside, it gets really gross really fast. I now clean it after each use which is a hassle, but I guess that's what you get for the price.
customer_reviews.author: diegorel

customer_reviews.title: I have had a Sonicare for years. It finally ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had a Sonicare for years. It finally could not hold a charge past a day. I bought this thinking it was across the board replacement. Not so. The 2 minutes are not broken up into 30 seconds, pause, then continue. It's 2 minutes continuous. I looked at the detail at Amazon. It did not state this. I called Phillips and brought this issue to their attention. Still it doesn't take 30 seconds to brush each side and back. But it was not what I saw or expected. That why I give it a lower rating.
customer_reviews.author: David N. Krafchick

customer_reviews.title: Just Buy It. You'll LOVE it.
customer_reviews.text: I am SO happy I bought this. After a recommendation from my dentist to go with Sonicare over the Oral-B, not only did I save money, but I love my toothbrush. I actually hate that I don't have a little pocket one to bring to work because my teeth feel so clean in the morning that I want that great feeling after lunch...Perhaps I'll have to order another! It is a little different from what you might expect, and it takes some getting use to, but I love it. I know my dentist is going to start seeing a difference in my teeth, I sure do!
customer_reviews.author: Shae

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! It vibrated so much at first it tickled my mouth and teeth. It was weird the first couple days using it but after that you get use to it and it is amazing! It makes your mouth feel so clean. It is gentle on your teeth also. If you are looking to get a nice electronic toothbrush this one I highly recommend! It also comes with a travel bag because they say it lasts 2 weeks on a full charge. I haven't tried that yet but pretty cool if it does.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Carter

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: My brother in law is a dentist and bought my husband one years ago saying it was the best. Now everyone in my family has one including the kids (the kids version). Once you start using them you will notice how much cleaner your mouth feels compared to a conventional brush. It also has a timer on it so you are more inclined to finish the full two minutes that dentists recommend. Well worth the investment on your future dental bills.
customer_reviews.author: EStylie

customer_reviews.title: Great cleaning, but inside where head screws on gets dirty easily
customer_reviews.text: This cleans better than the old Braun toothbrush I used to have. However, the inner parts of this toothbrush get extremely nasty if they aren't cleaned out every other day or so. Updated 8/25/2016 After having owned it for about two years, the toothbrush now just lasts a few days and then needs to be charged. Also has problems charging sometimes even after you reset it (hold down power button while in the charging station for about three seconds to reset).
customer_reviews.author: Bob Barker

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best tooth brushing experience you can have
customer_reviews.text: Just buy it. You're teeth have never been this clean before, trust me. You could brush for an hour with a normal toothbrush and not be as clean as this device makes them in 2 minutes. Your teeth will feel like they do after the dentist cleans them, every single day. Whiter, cleaner, smooth teeth. Removes tartar/plaque and junk between your teeth. Very inexpensive. Don't bother with the higher-priced models... the additional functionalities they have are just gimicks. This model is all you need. This is my second purchase because my wife kept stealing mine.
customer_reviews.author: K. Sandbek

customer_reviews.title: Very loud!
customer_reviews.text: This was for my husband and it is soo loud! He gets up very early for work and if he doesnt run the shower and shut the bathroom door the sound will wake me up and im not a light sleeper! It seems to work ok but not sure if its really better than a manual brush. I like that it has this neat charging base that it sits in instead of having to plug in. It also has a fairly durable carrying bag for travel! If not for the noise (that sounds like a smalk jack hammer btw) it would get 4 stars
customer_reviews.author: Jill Carabeau

customer_reviews.title: The best tooth brush out there
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I have been using Sonicare for the past 3 or 4 years after having it recommended to us by our son. Since we have started using it we have experienced a much cleaner feel and have been receiving great comments from out dental hygienist. Although a little pricey when compared to a regular tooth brush or many of the electric brushes, it is well worth the investment. I recommend Philips Sonicare to anyone who is interested in maintaining and keeping their teeth. The younger you start, the better
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Second time buyiing
customer_reviews.text: Toothbrush is very much like the other one we had about four years. I get very good dental yearly visits. My gums are in very good condition. The new brush does not let the tooth paste get in like the other one did so it is easier to maintain. I am not sure if the two minute timer is always accurate or maybe i am not paying attention. I do like using this toothbrush andwedidhave a discount coupon.
customer_reviews.author: Pauline shopping on line

customer_reviews.title: I think this was flawed, but I didn't send ...
customer_reviews.text: I think this was flawed, but I didn't send it back. My prior Sonicare paused every 30 seconds for a total of 2 minutes. The 30 second pause was designed to know that you spent that amount of time on each segment of your teeth cleaning...the front of teeth on bottom...the back of teeth on bottom...the front teeth on top...the back of teeth on top. This doesn't have a "pause" so unless you're watching the second hand on a clock, you don't know how much time you're spending brushing your teeth.
customer_reviews.author: Selective Lady

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is my very first "real" battery-operated toothbrush (replacing my rather abrasive Arm & Hammer). It came fully-charged and with a travel carrying case. It works really well and after about a month of using it, I can tell that my gums look healthier and I will never go back to a manual toothbrush again. The heads are also easily replaceable at your local Bed, Bath & Beyond. Plus they have a rebate typically. Not too shabby!
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Ari

customer_reviews.title: The CheckUps Proof Positive!
customer_reviews.text: This model works perfect given the dentist's approval during my last checkup. I think he spent two minutes cleaning only two areas with calcification (?) deposits and have never seen better gum health. I attribute this solely to electric mechanism vs manual. I am not as vigilent as I would like, but this compensates for the forgetful brusher. Am thoroughly pleased with this product for ease of use, battery longevity, and low cost. High recommend!
customer_reviews.author: DoMeNiQuE  CoE

customer_reviews.title: I would definitely always and forever stick with Phillips for longevity and quality.
customer_reviews.text: my 12 year old Philips finally bit the dust and wouldn't charge any longer. I was really having a hard time parting with it as it has been with me for so long and has always done an excellent job. my only level of comfort was replacing my Philips with the new Philips and however, my old one did not have the Sonicare feature.,it was delivered very quickly and packaged to get started quite easily. It was really quiet and I was super impressed with quality in which it cleans. Good job Phillips.
customer_reviews.author: notmyname

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use and Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised when I began using this product. I knew Sonicare has a reputation for quality, but I didn't expect that much from this lower-priced product. Boy, was I wrong! I love the timing feature that keeps me on track with brushing time and I especially love the clean feeling I get after using it. I recently took a trip for a week and didn't pack the charger. Didn't need it. It lasted the week with no trouble and the small carry case is really handy for traveling. All-in-all, I'd say this product is well worth the money, and then some.
customer_reviews.author: Susan M.

customer_reviews.title: Feels like I had a professional cleaning at the dentist!
customer_reviews.text: I've spend lots of money on different electric toothbrushes over the last few years because I didn't want to spend the $80 on a high end model. Recently the philips sonicare dropped in price so I snapped it up and I LOVE it! My teeth feel like I've just had a cleaning at the dentist every day. Awesome quality for the price. The one thing I've found is I had to purchase a toothpaste for sensitive teeth because the run of the mill tooth paste was too much with this intense brush.
customer_reviews.author: K'nATop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little toothbrush. My dentist who was a friend had previously bought me a $300 sonicare and it had a lot of trouble staying charged and finally broke after just a year of use. I couldn't afford to replace it. I was hesitant to order this as it was so cheap... but for the price you just can't beat it. I give it 5 stars because for the price it deserves 5 stars. It does not however come with different speeds.
customer_reviews.author: sam Booker

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I was devastated when my older brush went out! Found this one and it is perfect!!! THANK YOU!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Claro

customer_reviews.title: Not that great.
customer_reviews.text: I had a similar Sonicare for years and when this one arrived it worked fine for a few weeks....you know they run for a certain length cycle then shut off. Anyway, the cycle keeps getting shorter (most of the time) and has to be restarted. And no, the rechargeable battery is not at fault. It keeps a full charge all the time. There is just something wrong with the time cycle electronics and to me it is not worth the trouble sending it back. Though I will keep using it, it is not the quality I paid for!
customer_reviews.author: PAUL

customer_reviews.title: Power
customer_reviews.text: My dental hygienist has been recommending Sonicare for a while now, and I finally broke down and bought this one. The price is pretty good for a sonicare, and the power is amazing. After the first use, I could definitely feel a difference between the clean of this toothbrush and my old spinbrush. I hope my next dental check-up will show a difference too! This brush is also portable, the charge holds for a week, so you can take it with you on short trips without having to bring the charger.
customer_reviews.author: Wyomingcowgirl

customer_reviews.title: Works well and makes my breath fresher!
customer_reviews.text: Thus far works amazingly well. Leaves no tarter on teeth and my breath is fresher. I only charged it once for 24 hours and going strong one week later used twice a day. I have to give this 5 stars because I had a problem with breath being not s fresh and bought every mouthwash I could find, this worked after one day! So I'm not going back to a normal toothbrush again. Nothing else was different, same toothpaste same mouthwash.... this works.
customer_reviews.author: K R TTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Wife loved the one I bought for her so much I ...
customer_reviews.text: Wife loved the one I bought for her so much I got one for myself. They take a few days to get used to. I clean them once a week and it only takes a min. I have had no mold growth like some people complain about. The cleaning process takes less than a min and I use a little warm water and s cap full of hydrogen peroxide.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: My second one...
customer_reviews.text: I lost my charger for my first one (had that one since High School... a decade + ago) and decided to just get a whole new set, since it was on sale for about $10 more than just the charger. Very happy to have my smooth, clean teeth back. You won't know what you've been missing until you try a Sonicare. My boyfriend tried mine and immediately ordered their "diamond"- the most expensive one. I'm happy with my cheaper one, thank you.
customer_reviews.author: SunnyDenver

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: I like the way my teeth feel after I use this toothbrush. I also love that it goes for 2 minutes then shuts itself off so you know you're cleaning for the correct amount of time. Be careful however on not hitting your other teeth with it. It will vibrate the hell out of you. It's worth a buy but the replacement heads are costly. This does NOT come with an extra toothbrush head. Just the one.
customer_reviews.author: Roseann Bell

customer_reviews.title: My first electric toothbrush - moving up in the world!
customer_reviews.text: Went from using the old stick and bristles to this electric toothbrush. It's not as fancy as other models I looked at but it was on a really good deal and Phillips Sonicare is a recommended brand by my dentist's office. I haven't had to test the 2 weeks on one charge claim yet. I noticed with my old tooth brushes that it was easy to miss parts of my teeth when brushing, but I've noticed with this toothbrush that my teeth get really clean with 2 minutes of brushing. Happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: J Mac

customer_reviews.title: This is not recommended, but I occasionally use a very dilute bleach ...
customer_reviews.text: You can't store it with the brush on. Also, you need to gently push the plastic ring on the brush up past the rubber seal to make sure everything dries correctly. This is not recommended, but I occasionally use a very dilute bleach solution to get any mold out of the top of the brush. This sounds like a lot of overhead, but it's not that bad. The brush it powerful and durable, with good battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Nate H

customer_reviews.title: A Truly Wonderful Oral Care Product...however,
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this is wonderful. Can't recommend it highly enough. This is a replacement for another one I had for years - and which finally wore out. The only glitch: when you first buy it, the vibrator motor is turned way down for the first 14 uses (to get newbies' gums acclimated to it, I discovered). I thought there was some defect -- called their 800#...and a nice guy told me how to bypass that 14-day slow-vibration situation. (It is in the manual - small type somewhere ion pg 14 or something - but who reads all that stuff when it's just a toothbrush). They should point this out on page 2 perhaps.
customer_reviews.author: R. Childs

customer_reviews.title: Great toothbrush overall, just one thing I don't particularly like.
customer_reviews.text: Great toothbrush overall, just one thing I don't particularly like. First, I'll start with the pros: - great clean - my teeth are visibly whiter/cleaner - my mouth feels healthier - love the 2 min timer - battery charge lasts a looong time The only drawback for me has been the design of the removable brush head. This part can get a bit icky if you don't unscrew the top and clean it regular. A minor drawback, though, to an otherwise great electric toothbrush at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: A.S.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing for the price! All though it's the basic version, it does the job. I alternate between this and my manual toothbrush and my teeth and gums are healthy. My dentist recommended that I get these and I am glad I purchased them. I don't have any issues with mold like others are commenting. I leave my brush to air-dry completely and have had no such issues. Love this toothbrush!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I would purchase the other version in the future
customer_reviews.text: Sonic care offers 2 versions of their brush's. This version has a large knob at the bottom of the brush refill which is half of the motor assembly. the refills are $30.00 each. I've also got the other version that has just a brush as a refill. I'd never purchase this again as the refill will bankrupt me. Don't recommend this model but LOVE SONCICARE
customer_reviews.author: CT

customer_reviews.title: it cleans your teeth extremely well without using excessive force like traditional tooth brushes do
customer_reviews.text: After five years using my old Sonicare toothbrush of the same model, it would only hold a charge for 15 minutes of brushing. I had to buy a new one because the battery would no longer recharge long enough. This toothbrush is the new version of my old one. I charged it once and so far haven't had to charge it for the last three weeks. As for cleaning your teeth, it cleans your teeth extremely well without using excessive force like traditional tooth brushes do.
customer_reviews.author: John G.

customer_reviews.title: Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews prior to purchasing and was very impressed with the honesty. I did not want to spend a lot of money on an electric toothbrush, but my hygienist suggested that I get one. So I immediately got online with Amazon. The Phillips is a great brand name. The packaging is just as described. The toothbrush works exactly as described. It allows me to brush my teeth for 2 minutes. It is easy to clean and store. It was a great price and an awesome product.
customer_reviews.author: Teacherbug9

customer_reviews.title: I'm disappointed in Sonicare
customer_reviews.text: I'm disappointed in Sonicare. The wand units don't seem to last very long - this was our third replacement over ten years. I would expect better longevity. Also, this particular unit does not have the 30 second "quad timer." I ordered it not realizing that the timer was an "extra" feature. It doesn't seem like a big deal but we really miss it. I would switch to another brand but we have a pack of "e" brushes to use and they aren't cheap either. So I get bummed about Sonicare every time I brush my teeth...
customer_reviews.author: Smith2724

customer_reviews.title: I love this toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought me one of these, and I liked it enough that when hers died I bought her one too. We used battery toothbrushes for many years, but these are a little different. The smooth, minimal seams design means they don't build up anywhere near as much grunge as my old one - the wireless charging is a great feature. The sensation as the brush touches your gums is a little different from my old toothbrush - almost tickly - almost annoying, but wears off after a couple of days.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: You cant go wrong with SonicCare
customer_reviews.text: Perfect replacement unit. My previous unit ran over 8 years before I bought this one. I have heavily invested in the heads and I had to go get the same type of head attachment vs the other type. This device works well. It cleans like the old one, and now the battery holds charge for 2 weeks. Not bad for an 8 year run on the previous unit. I hope this one will last as long too.
customer_reviews.author: M. Bose

customer_reviews.title: "I love this toothbrush"
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these as gifts. I received a "I love this toothbrush" from both people. (Both teenage girls who would definitely say if they didn't like them) One of them noticed the timer and one didn't.... That was an easy way to tell the one that she wasn't brushing long enough.... I'd be happier if the toothbrush fit into the base a little better. It will fall out if you give it a little bump. Other than that, no complaints so far.
customer_reviews.author: Beau

customer_reviews.title: Dentist recomended
customer_reviews.text: This replaces a previous sonicare that wore out, This one shuts off after the recommended 2 minutes. Now if I would just use it more often. It works great. I have to take the brush off every other week and clean out the well where toothpaste has dripped down the shaft & it is a little hard to get inside with fat fingers but a damp handkerchief works great.
customer_reviews.author: Tedsters dad

customer_reviews.title: great product, a few criticisms
customer_reviews.text: It's a great product with few minor issues. One; the handle is a little too large and hard to grip for my small hands. Two; I'd prefer a warning that time is ending. It stops abruptly. That said, once I got the hang of pause/restart, it has been great. My previous brush was a Spinbrush sonic, which sometimes made my mouth sore and was not quite as effective. The Sonicare hasn't caused any sores or soreness from brushing top of the molars. It also leaves my mouth feeling cleaner longer.
customer_reviews.author: M. Andersen

customer_reviews.title: OUTSTANDING!
customer_reviews.text: Just to clarify, this is my 1st electronic toothbrush and I'm amazed at the results. Brushing my teeth with this toothbrush has made brushing fun again, and somewhat addictive! It leaves your mouth feeling tingly and clean in all hard to reach areas including the back of the tongue. For $35 I'd say this a steal when one realizes just how great of a product this is. I will definitely recommend this product to family and friends. If you want great results, white shiners and fresh smelling breath look no further than this bargai!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Best toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: This is a great toothbrush I'm sure it cleans just as well as the more expensive versions. Sonicare toothbrushes do a great job of cleaning your teeth. Before getting this toothbrush I had used other electric toothbrushes, although I thought they worked fine it was not until I got my first Sonicare that I saw a real improvement in cleaning. Before I started using Sonicare the dental assistants cleaning my teeth would ask me if I smoked(no) or if I drank a lot of coffee(yes). Now I don't hear that anymore!
customer_reviews.author: RFC

customer_reviews.title: These toothbrushes are fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: After my Oral B toothbrush finally gave up, I went back to the old manual brushes for a while. The Oral B was pretty expensive and I didn't want to buy another one that I couldn't service with new battery in the future. The manual brush really isn't as effective though, so I bought the Sonicare unit. WOW! This thing really works! After the first use, my teeth felt like I'd just come back from the dentist. I've been so pleased that I've bought one for each member of my family.
customer_reviews.author: Lux and the Machinist

customer_reviews.title: The travel case fits nicely and the base it actually a good feature but ...
customer_reviews.text: The travel case fits nicely and the base it actually a good feature but the tooth brush one has one timer. It runs for 2 minutes and then stops. The one I used to have would beep every 30 seconds so you knew you were getting every section of your mouth with equal time. Seeing as Im adult and I can typically brush my teeth thoroughly enough not to need this feature, Im okay that its not there. I just didn't think the newer models wouldn't have that.
customer_reviews.author: Anna F

customer_reviews.title: it is a wonderful toothbrush. It was purchased for the son of ...
customer_reviews.text: Even though this is one of the older models, it is a wonderful toothbrush. It was purchased for the son of a friend and he loves it. These are meant to remain on the base, but for some reason I see it left in the bathroom 'off' the base and apparently the battery life is really good. I personally wouldn't leave it off the base, but it looks like it can take it. At least as far as I can tell.
customer_reviews.author: DeAnn

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend a newer model where the brush head attaches to ...
customer_reviews.text: Despite constantly detaching the brush head from the base to air out and cleaning it occasionally, black gunk still forms in places that it is very difficult to clear because of the way this toothbrush is set up. Would recommend a newer model where the brush head attaches to an exterior piece, so you are not left with a save of black gunk that is hard to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Natalia

customer_reviews.title: Is It What You Wanted?
customer_reviews.text: Make sure this is what you are intending to order. I did not look carefully enough at the picture or at the replacement heads for this unit. This product has the "older style" head with the large screw-on brush device. And the body is somewhat thicker. Not what I had intended, but what I received is what is pictured. We have used the newer style for several years and I was intending to replace one. I'll keep this anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: After getting this you'll never want to use a manual toothbrush again!
customer_reviews.text: Time will tell just how well this toothbrush works, but my teeth felt very clean after using this. No matter how many times I've used the manual toothbrush per day it doesn't even come close to how well this cleans and the Sonicare isn't even operating at full power right now. Philips does this intentionally to help people adjust to the toothbrush. After about 12 brushings, it will increase to full power. Needless to say I recommend this to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Norma Alvazaz

customer_reviews.title: excellent toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: I like this toothbrush very much and I recommend it. The handle is a bit chunky, but is easy to hold. The base is easy to keep clean. I like the carrying case and have used it when traveling - it keeps the the toothbrush clean. My old Sonicare had the quadri-pace feature, and this one does not. I miss that feature a little bit, but I have adjusted to it and have no regrets about buying this model. A very good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: M. Zehngut

customer_reviews.title: Great product, Great price.
customer_reviews.text: We have used our own Philips Sonicare toothbrushes for years. We originally bought ours because of the recommendation of our dentist. This one was purchased as a gift for a very close friend who is a senior citizen in his 80's. It is his first electric toothbrush and he reports that he really likes it. Whether for yourselves, or as a gift, these brand of toothbrushes can't be beat. We would recommend them to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Bill in Casa Grande

customer_reviews.title: This toothbrush was recommend to me by my dentist
customer_reviews.text: This toothbrush was recommend to me by my dentist. I had a previous model that sucked batteries and gave up on it. This one is rechargeable and keeps the charge for a long time. The cleaning action is excellent and the two minute timed cleaning cycle has actually trained me to use it for the entire time until it automatically shuts off. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: SBS

customer_reviews.title: Replaced a different model that was leaking.
customer_reviews.text: I had a similar model with the same style of brush. That one developed leaks: Brown-gray goo oozed into the magnet compartment on a regular basis. After a couple years I decided I don't like the taste of the brown-gray goo, and it probably isn't safe to eat while brushing. I am hopeful this unit will last longer before leaking since battery technology is improving. I still rate it 5 stars because it is much better than a manual toothbrush.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job Well :)
customer_reviews.text: Though this is the simpler version of what has many different kinds and features now, it still does the job well. I don't need the fancy ones as this one is good enough and has the self timer that tells you how long to brush overall. I used to have one that tells you how long to brush each part of you mouth and there was a capability of vibration strength, but for me personally I found it unnecessary and like this one better. Great travel case included. Awesome fast shipping! :)
customer_reviews.author: CaliforniaSun21

customer_reviews.title: The Best!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Philips Sonicare toothbrush I have had. The first one stopped working after having it for many years. My dentist recommended it and I have been very satisfied with it. For that and mainly because of the good job it does keeping my teeth clean, I ordered this one. It will automatically turn off after two minutes. I keep the toothbrush in the recharger and it is always ready to use. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Alice M. GroveTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy; 3rd-party customer service will not continue supporting this defective product
customer_reviews.text: My purchase in August 2015 is still under Philips' 2.5 year warranty, but after numerous breakdowns and replacements Philips' 3rd-party customer service stopped sending me more replacements. My original purchase lasted a year before it stopped holding a charge; subsequent replacement units wouldn't even last a month. PLEASE DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.author: A.J. Ho

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with this
customer_reviews.text: Great tooth brush. My 2nd in 7 years. The first one lasted way longer than the MFR even expects it to, as I called their service when the 1st one stopped working, and the rep was surprised it lasted so much longer than the 3-or-so years they expect the battery to work for. Also got a better price here than anywhere else, including with the generous coupon Phillips gave me off their company store prices when I called their service line.
customer_reviews.author: Kilo Bravo

customer_reviews.title: I love my Sonicare.  Sonicare is all I buy every few years.  Consistently reliable and great product every year thus far!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Sonicare. Sonicare is all I buy every few years. Consistently reliable and great product every year thus far! They last anywhere between 2 to 6 years each, so these are a GREAT buy! Plus, I always get great marks from my dentist...and he doesn't know I don't floss! :P
customer_reviews.author: ALS

customer_reviews.title: Overall works, however replacement brushes are expensive
customer_reviews.text: Title says it all. So does the empty space in my wallet. But let's be honest I would be broke even if I didn't buy this

customer_reviews.title: I lost my Sonicare when we moved and had to ...
customer_reviews.text: I lost my Sonicare when we moved and had to use a regular toothbrush. There was obviously no comparison! My teeth just didn't feel as clean with my regular toothbrush! I'm very grateful I found my Sonicare a few months later and will be sure to never lose it again.
customer_reviews.author: ginger

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great toothbrush and have received good results in dental check ups after using this.
customer_reviews.author: Mari J. Clark

customer_reviews.title: I will only buy electric toothbrushes from now on. ...
customer_reviews.text: I will only buy electric toothbrushes from now on. My teeth feel so much cleaner after using this and they stay cleaner for longer. I can't believe Ive used a normal toothbrush for so long. I've even had people compliment me on how white my teeth are and this is the only thing in my oral hygiene routine that I've changed. I will continue buying this product for sure.
customer_reviews.author: I'mtired

customer_reviews.title: My teeth have never felt cleaner!
customer_reviews.text: I'd had the Sonicare Intelliclean System brush a while ago, but it became more and more difficult to find the toothpaste refills, so I switched back to my manual toothbrush. I stumbled upon this while browsing Amazon one day, and decided to give it a try. My teeth have never felt cleaner! This is the best toothbrush I have ever used!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: A must buy.
customer_reviews.text: My mom recommended the Sonicare and I absolutely love it! I don't know how I lived without it. After use, my mouth feels super clean unlike any manual toothbrush. The charge is absolutely amazing. I went 3 weeks without charging it until it finally died (I brought it on a trip with me and forgot the charger). I do suggest unscrewing it and rinsing off the inside. It gets dirty in there.
customer_reviews.author: C. Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Keep that clean feeling
customer_reviews.text: At the instruction of my dentist, I purchased this toothbrush. I actually got it for a steal at $29.95. After undergoing a deep cleaning, I've found that this toothbrush keeps my teeth white and keeps plaque at bay. It's high powered and takes some getting used to, but it is great so far. I really can't see any problems with it except that I do like to brush my teeth between heavy meals so I don't see myself taking it on the go, but for a good brushing morning and night, this is the right toothbrush.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Thomas

customer_reviews.title: hooray!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why people rate this product less than five stars. Who needs a beep to signal it's time to move to another section of teeth??!! Give me a break. This model works great, and IMHO why spend all that extra money on a model that has bells and whistles? I'll admit I grill my steaks with a timer, but need a timer to brush teeth? Nope. If it stops and you're not finished just turn it on again and get the job done. Low price works great Happy wallet Clean teeth Happy mouth!
customer_reviews.author: William L

customer_reviews.title: You can't go wrong with a Sonicare in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 13 year old son, who needed to be reminded to brush his teeth twice a day and to do a *good* job. I think the Sonicare helps him to do a much better job of brushing. It has the timer on it for one thing, so he brushes for a full two minutes, but it is also just a superior clean with this brush. I know this because I've used Sonicare for 10 years. The price was reasonable too, compared to what the Sonicares used to cost.
customer_reviews.author: L.B.

customer_reviews.title: My teeth have never been cleaner!
customer_reviews.text: My husband got one for Christmas, and I tried it for about a week with the additional head that came with his system. I fell in love and HAD to get my own. I know his mom paid about $80 for his, and I couldn't believe that I found such a great deal on the exact same model on Amazon. It works perfectly, and better than any dental hygiene product I've ever purchased! I'll never use a manual toothbrush again!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: this toothbrush is horrible! Great the first month but then we noticed disgusting black mold all over the inside and around the edges. We unscrewed our toothbrushes everyday after use to help with the build up of the black crap but it didn't really help. It is so gross and unsanitary and now I don't use it anymore. Don't spend any money on this junk! Wish I could return it and get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Would not fit my brushes
customer_reviews.text: This toothbrush is a good one I am sure but it would not fit the brushes that I have from an older model. I could not use it since it did not fit my pack and half of brushes that I purchased some time ago. My old unit started working again after I ordered this one so I made a mistake in ordering this one. I was able to return it and the company was very good about allowing me to send it back. Thank you for correcting my mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Gross
customer_reviews.text: Water, toothpaste, etc. get "caught" in the area where the brush fits onto the base. Really gross. It gets moldy and disgusting. I wish I could get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Dentist approved.
customer_reviews.text: My dentist told me he knows I don't floss...but said my Sonic Care must be doing it for me. I'll never use a traditional toothbrush.
customer_reviews.author: Donny M.

customer_reviews.title: Great electric toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: As someone who has never used an electric toothbrush, it took me approximately 2-3 cleanings to get used to it. The first couple of times that I used it, it tickled too much that I had to switch to my manual toothbrush. But I quickly became accustomed to it, and now love it! The toothbrush shuts off after 2 minutes, indicating that you're good to go! It fits comfortably. It came charged and ready to use. I've only had to recharge it once in 2 weeks time. Will be great for travel as I won't have to take the recharger.
customer_reviews.author: soninha

product_meta.title: Philips Sonicare Essence 5600 Sonic Electric Rechargeable Toothbrush, White, HX5610/30
product_meta.description: Taking care of your oral health is easy with the Philips Sonicare Essence 5600. This rechargeable power toothbrush features a unique angled neck, extra-soft contoured bristles, and patented Sonic technology to gently remove plaque in hard-to-reach areas. An Easy-start feature helps you acclimate to the Sonicare experience, and a two-minute timer ensures you brush adequately. For further convenience, the Essence 5600 remains charged for up to two weeks, a great feature for traveling. This toothbrush arrives in Amazon frustration-free packaging, which is recyclable, easy to open, and ships in its own box.
feature_bullets: Up to 2x better plaque removal versus a manual toothbrush
Includes soft-grip handle designed for comfort and control, 1 contoured brush head, charger base, and travel case. Includes 1 e-Series brush head
Patented sonic technology- dynamic cleaning action drives fluid between teeth and along the gum line to gently remove plaque
2-minute smartimer ensures dentist recommended brushing time

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
